Great! Keep in mind that there are still a few(!) kinks. The Jmdns 
package doesn't work too well (sometimes a client will  resolve the 
server and sometimes it wont - seemingly randomly). If you can't get 
the client to work, try stopping it and starting it again.

Another problem - the server and client don't like to be stopped with 
^C (or rather - they refuse to die). I haven't put in correct ^C 
handlers yet, so you'll have to suspend the jobs (if you're using linux 
or OS X) with ^Z and then kill -9 them.

Thanks,
Reuben

--
